claude-code.description: In Claude Code, use CLAUDE.md to set persistent scope boundaries, or state constraints directly in your prompt.
claude-code.code:
# In CLAUDE.md:
## Scope Rules
- Only modify files I explicitly mention
- Don't refactor surrounding code
- Don't add features I didn't ask for
- Ask before creating new files

# In a prompt:
Fix the pagination bug in src/api/tasks.ts.
Only modify that file. Don't touch the
frontend components or add new features.

cursor.description: In Cursor, use .cursorrules for persistent boundaries and be explicit about scope in each prompt.
cursor.code:
# In .cursorrules:
When fixing bugs:
- Only modify the file containing the bug
- Don't refactor adjacent code
- Don't add error handling elsewhere
- Don't update tests unless asked

# In a prompt:
Fix the off-by-one error in src/utils/paginate.ts
line 23. Only change that function. Don't modify
any other files.

copilot.description: In Copilot, set scope constraints in .github/copilot-instructions.md and reinforce in prompts.
copilot.code:
# In .github/copilot-instructions.md:
Scope discipline:
- Only edit files explicitly named in the request
- Never refactor code outside the scope
- Ask before creating new files

# In a prompt:
Fix the pagination bug in src/api/tasks.ts.
Don't modify any other files. Don't add
new error handling or refactor.

windsurf.description: In Windsurf, use .windsurfrules for persistent scope rules and explicit prompt constraints.
windsurf.code:
# In .windsurfrules:
Strict scope rules:
- Only modify files I name
- No refactoring outside scope
- No new files without permission

# In a prompt:
Fix the pagination in src/api/tasks.ts only.
Don't touch frontend code, don't add features,
don't refactor surrounding functions.
